revised_title: The Persistence of Palaeozoic Coral Types in Guynia annulata and its Affinities
tldr: The author examines the unique coral species Guynia annulata and its distinct rugose characteristics, discovering that it shares affinities with Palaeozoic coral types. This finding challenges the widely held belief that Palaeozoic corals are entirely distinct from those in Neozoic periods.
